feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission describes a working investment application that generates portfolio recommendations, produces allocations and risk analysis for multiple user profiles, and performs historical backtests using market data via APIs. Implementation details and multiple example outputs show thorough, functional treatment of the financial-application criterion.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows substantive, non-superficial AI integration: model selection and prompt design, programmatic connection of live/backtest data via APIs, and AI-generated personalized outputs with explanations and historical performance. These concrete implementations and the student's reflection demonstrate a thorough, value-adding integration consistent with a PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "The AI application that I wanted to make was a personalized investment portfolio app that um could take any user's input and create a personalized investment portfolio."
"But first what we did was build a back test with API in Python. So what it did was use Yahoo Finance to pull all the historical data."

"we can see that this portfolio compared to the S&P 500 would have a massive return. Since it is equities only and we're looking all the way back at 2010 and includes stocks like Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, we can expect this."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover — articulated the financial problem and target users (need for personalized portfolios).  
Implement — built a working backtest, used Yahoo Finance API, turned a local API public, wired live graphs and connected outputs to the AI app.  
Reflect — demonstrated learning about prompt engineering and API management validating a functional financial tool.
criteria.reasoning: The submission describes a working investment application that generates portfolio recommendations, produces allocations and risk analysis for multiple user profiles, and performs historical backtests using market data via APIs. Implementation details and multiple example outputs show thorough, functional treatment of the financial-application criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "The AI application that I wanted to make was a personalized investment portfolio app that um could take any user's input and create a personalized investment portfolio."
"we're going to be using Google AI studio. We're going to start with the core model. We're going to build a super basic framework uh prompt..."

"So the way I went about this was building with chat GPT. This took me probably about 3 to four hours last night. But first what we did was build a back test with API in Python. So what it did was use Yahoo Finance to pull all the historical data."
criteria.driver_alignment: The DISCOVER stage identified a concrete user problem and AI solution (personalized portfolio). The IMPLEMENT stage shows concrete integration steps (Google AI Studio core model, prompt development, ChatGPT-assisted coding, local-to-public API, Yahoo Finance backtest). The REFLECT stage documents learning about prompt engineering and API management, confirming substantive hands-on AI work.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows substantive, non-superficial AI integration: model selection and prompt design, programmatic connection of live/backtest data via APIs, and AI-generated personalized outputs with explanations and historical performance. These concrete implementations and the student's reflection demonstrate a thorough, value-adding integration consistent with a PASS.
